page.title: 07Carmalite Convent Eccleston
page.content: The Convent is 70 years old but the Convent building is older. The wall is built of sandstone but they have raised it. The nuns used to make robes for the priests at St.Julies church but they don't anymore.Sister Michael has been there the longest and is now 93 years old. There is a wooden statue which is only 4 months old and it was put there by the sisters who pray four times a day. There are 13 nuns in the convent. It has not been vandalised but they put barbed wire around the edge of the wall to stop young boys climbing over. The nuns relatives can visit. It has not suffered any damage. Where the convent used to be a house called Springfield House. It was owned by the Greenall family and then they sold it to the Cottoms who added a wall in 1903 to 1904.
